title: PROBET BIOPSY
description: This is a simple out-patient procedure where we insert a thin straw like plastic tube inside the uterus and suck out a little of the inner lining of the uterus called the endometrium for the purpose of sending it for biopsy .

faq.question: Why is an endometrial biopsy done?
faq.answer:
It is done in cases of abnormal uterine bleeding or postmenopausal bleeding in order to test the tissue for any disordered growth which may be a precursor of uterine cancer.

It may detect early stages of uterine cancer also in some women.

It is an easier alternative to the traditional Dilatation and curettage (D&C) as there is no need for admission or anesthesia.

faq.question: Who might need an endometrial biopsy?
faq.answer:
For those who have the following indications endometrial biopsy:

  • Heavy or very long menstrual periods.
  • Irregular menstruation.
  • Bleeding after menopause.
  • Thickened uterine lining, determined by an ultrasound.

faq.question: Is it painful?
faq.answer:
There may be minimum discomfort during the procedure which is usually reduced in minutes.
Painkillers may be prescribed if required to be taken for a day after the procedure.

faq.question: What are the benefits of an endometrial biopsy?
faq.answer: An endometrial biopsy is the most common and accurate test used to diagnose endometrial cancer. We will get the biopsy report from pathology in5 to 7 working days and this will help us treat you accordingly.
